title: Is equality a principle or value? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s a value. A principle would be a statement of a rule that puts that value into action, such as “All people should be treated equally.” Equality itself is too abstract to count as a principle. Different people could all agree on the value of equality, but disagree strongly about what principle to apply in pursuit of it. Some might say “All people should be treated equally.” Others might say (historically) that “All white males should be treated equally.” Others might say, “Everyone should have equal opportunities,” which is different from “Everyone should have access to equally good outcomes.”
